summary_md: Proved (now rigorous): for any unrooted property P the set S_P = {(G,ρ): G has P} is saturated, and for any saturated S the closure cl(S) and interior Int(cl(S)) are also saturated (proof by transporting large matching balls and re‑rooting). Hence Int(cl(S_P))=∅ is root‑free, so nowhere density of S_P does not depend on the choice of root — the conjecture is resolved for nowhere density. Caveat: the quotient map that forgets the root need not be open, so meagreness cannot be transferred via a naive quotient argument. Current plan for the meagre part: build a comeagre locally rigid domain Good_∞ via degree‑preserving markers so countably many partial re‑rooting homeomorphisms generate finite re‑rootings there; show each Bad_{m,ℓ} is nowhere dense so Good_∞ is comeagre; conclude that saturations of nowhere‑dense sets are meagre. Remaining technical work: explicit marker gadgets (especially for Δ= D, odd/even) and either a Borel/continuous selector on a comeagre domain or a counterexample. Citations: Current Proofs; papers/paper1.txt.
one_line_summary: Nowhere density of S_P is root‑invariant; meagre case remains open.
highlights: Key lemma: if S is saturated then cl(S) and Int(cl(S)) are saturated (proved).
S_P is saturated for any unrooted property P, so nowhere‑dense status is root‑independent.
Quotient map forgetting the root need not be open — prevents simple quotient transfer of meagreness.
Planned route for meagreness: construct Good_∞ (comeagre local rigidity) using degree‑preserving markers and show Bad_{m,ℓ} are nowhere dense.
Goal: show saturation of a nowhere‑dense set is meagre via countable union of re‑rooting homeomorphic images plus a meagre exceptional set.
Outstanding technical gap: build explicit marker gadgets for Δ= D (odd/even) and complete proofs that Bad_{m,ℓ} are nowhere dense.
next_questions: Finish the Good_∞ construction with uniform markers (handle Δ= D odd/even) and prove each Bad_{m,ℓ} is nowhere dense.
Either produce a Borel/continuous selector on a comeagre domain of uniquely marked roots, or construct a counterexample showing meagre equivalence can fail.
Record the metric off‑by‑one correction and the safe non‑emptiness criterion for cylinders (optional housekeeping).
